intro: Grammitis minutissima, commonly known as the minute spikemoss, is a small, epiphytic fern that belongs to the family Huperjaniaceae. It is characterized by its tiny, densely packed leaves that form a compact, moss-like structure. The plant typically grows on tree trunks or branches in humid, shaded environments, often in tropical and subtropical regions. Its reproductive structures, known as sporangia, are borne on short, branched stalks at the tips of the leaves. Grammitis minutissima is notable for its delicate appearance and its role in forest ecosystems as a component of the epiphytic flora.
